burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis.common

Class PolicyGlyphPainter2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis.common.PolicyGlyphPainter2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StatePolicyPainter

    public class PolicyGlyphPainter2D
extends Object
implements StatePolicyPainter
    An class for rendering the policy for states by painting different glyphs for different actions. There are three different ways to paint the policy: (1) just painting the glyph for the most likely action (and all that tie as the most likely); (2) glyphs for all actions whose likelihood is within some threshold of the most likely action; (3) glyphs for all actions with the glyphs scaled by how likely the action is.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PolicyGlyphPainter2D.PolicyGlyphRenderStyle
      MAXACTION paints only glphys for only those actions that have the highest likelihood

      The max probability difference from the most likely action for which an action that is not the most likely will still be rendered under the MAXACTIONSOFTTIE rendering style.

      • setXYKeys

        public void setXYKeys(Object xKey,
                      Object yKey,
                      VariableDomain xRange,
                      VariableDomain yRange,
                      double xWidth,
                      double yWidth)
        Sets the variable keys for the x and y variables in the state and the width of cells along those domains. The widths along the x dimension are how much of the variable space each rendered state will take.
        Parameters:
        xKey - the x variable key
        yKey - the y variable key
        xRange - the range of the x values
        yRange - the range of the y values
        xWidth - the width of a state along the x domain
        yWidth - the width of a state alone the y domain

      • rescaleRect

        protected float[] rescaleRect(float x,
                              float y,
                              float width,
                              float height,
                              float scale)
        Takes in a rectangle specification and scales it equally along each direction by a scale factor.
        Parameters:
        x - the left side of the rectangle
        y - the top side of the rectangle
        width - the width of the rectangle
        height - the height of the rectangle
        scale - the scale factor
        Returns:
        a double array with the new x, y, width, and height values of the scaled rectangle.
